title: Hummus Masabacha (Hummus With Whole Chickpeas)
full_text:
Hummus Masabacha (Hummus With Whole Chickpeas)
Close

8 hrs 10 mins

9 hrs 55 mins

8
to 10 servings

5 cups
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)

dried chickpeas

level

Warm pita bread
, for serving
Directions
Combine chickpeas, 1 teaspoon (6g) baking soda, and 2 tablespoons (24g) salt in a large bowl. Cover with 6 cups (1.4L) cold water. Stir to dissolve salt and baking soda. Let stand at room temperature overnight. Drain and rinse chickpeas thoroughly.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Place chickpeas in a large Dutch oven or saucepan. Add remaining baking soda, 1 tablespoon (12g) salt, onion, garlic, and bay leaves. Add 6 cups (1.4L) water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce to a simmer, cover with lid slightly cracked, and cook until chickpeas are completely tender and nearly falling apart, about 1 hour 30 minutes. Check on chickpeas occasionally and top up with more water if necessary; they should be completely submerged at all times. Let cool slightly. Discard onion, garlic, and bay leaves. Drain chickpeas, reserving their cooking water.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
In a mixing bowl, combine tahini sauce with chickpeas and parsley. Stir, mashing some of the chickepas into the tahini until thoroughly mixed and chickpeas are coated in a creamy, thickened sauce. (If you prefer the sauce thinner, gently work in a little of the reserved cooking liquid.) You can refrigerate the hummus at this point; it will become thicker in the refrigerator.
Serious Eats / Vicky Wasik
Spoon onto a serving dish, drizzle with olive oil, and top with garnishes of your choice. Serve with warm pita bread.
